result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sondra L Ferguson

records.addlTxt:
9:24 AM Defendant Sondra L Ferguson in court.  Attorney Brooke L Houston in court for Sondra L Ferguson.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests for time to comply with the conditions of the offer.
After completing 10 hours of community service this matter is anticipated to be resolved as a citation.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:43 AM Attorney Brooke L Houston appeared by video for Sondra L Ferguson. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Defense has received some discovery and is awaiting additional discovery.
Defendant to appear in person for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to Appear and Act, filed by Atty. Houston

Letter to Judge Bohren requesting to appear via zoom, filed by Atty. Houston

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 6, 2022 - 9/9/22 is a status hearing; Zoom approved for Counsel.**

Letter to Court dated August 26, 2022 request new court date, filed by Atty. Houston

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 27, 2022 - Clerk to leave hearing of 9/9 on court's calendar. Clerk will remove 10/12 hearing.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, with the exception of third party contact for purposes of insurance.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

8:34 AM Defendant Sondra L Ferguson in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
